pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:5.1: 59. The training rule on going to the instruction
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.2: At that time the nuns did not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.3: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.4: “How can nuns not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns don’t do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.8: How can nuns not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:6.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:7.1: ‘Every half-month a nun should question the Order of monks about two things: enquiring about the observance day and going to the instruction. If she goes beyond that, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:8.4: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:9.2: the eight principles to be respected.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:9.3: If she thinks, “I will not enquire about the observance day, I will not ask about going to the instruction,” then by the mere fact of giving up the duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:10.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:11.1: The ninth training rule is finished.
